page.title: 06Farming-Arable-Collyhill
page.content: The farm of Collyhill lying to the north east of Inverurie is primarily an arable farm. The farm has belonged to the Green family for 107 years. Mr Green specialises in this type of farming because the soil on Collyhill, varying from light to clay, is ideal for crop growing and because he feels most profit can be made from this. On his 260 acres Mr Green grows barley, wheat and turnips. The main crop is barley. Most of his yield is sold to agricultural suppliers to be used as seed, some goes to the local distillery in Oldmeldrum to be used in the making of Glen Garioch whisky and the rest is kept to feed his own animals. Collyhill also supports a flock of 80 half breed ewes and their lambs and a herd of 250 fattening cattle.
